overview:
co-Founder, Executive Director

B. 1981, Tokyo. French citizen. After receiving the French Baccalaureate, graduated from the University of California in Los Angeles [2003] B.A. Design/Media Arts. M.A. in Interdisciplinary Information Studies from the University of Tokyo [2006]. Researcher at NTT InterCommunication Center-ICC [2003], Research Associate at the International University of Japan, Global Communication Center [2005], Japan Society for the Promotion of Science (JSPS) Fellow Researcher at the University of Tokyo, iii [2006]. Public Lead of NPO Creative Commons Japan [2006]. Nominated to the International Advisory Board of Ars Electronica 2007 and 2008 for the Digital Community category. From 2001, has written various media theories focusing on the philosophy of plasticity in such magazines. From 2004, has directed NTT ICC’s open video archive HIVE, and has been actively involved to the Creative Commons movement.While building dividual. inc, currently leading research in media prochronism and its relation with creativity.
